_comment: These are the default properties for Traffic Portal. Customize these values to fit your needs.

api._comment: This should have the same value found in /etc/traffic_portal/conf/config.js

dashboard._comments: These are configurable properties for the dashboard

snapshot._comments: These are configurable properties for a cdn snapshot

dsRequests._comments: Should all delivery service changes go through the delivery service review process?

cacheChecks._comments: These are configurable properties for the cache checks view. The data for the cache checks view is derived from TO extensions.

descriptions.10G: Ping the IPv4 address of the EDGE or MID servers
descriptions.10G6: Ping the IPv6 address of the EDGE or MID servers
descriptions.DSCP: Checks the DSCP value of packets from the edge server to the Traffic Ops server
descriptions.FQDN: DNS check that matches what the DNS servers responds with compared to what Traffic Ops has
descriptions.ILO: Ping the iLO interface for EDGE or MID servers
descriptions.MTU: Ping the EDGE or MID using the configured MTU from Traffic Ops
descriptions.ORT: Number of configuration differences as determined by ORT found between Traffic Ops and the cache
descriptions.RVL: Content invalidation request(s) are pending for the EDGE or MID
descriptions.UPD: Configuration file updates have been applied or are pending for the EDGE or MID

defaults._comments: These are default values used when creating resources

customMenu._comments: These are custom items you want to add to the menu. 'items' is an array of hashes where each hash has 'name' (the menu item name), 'embed' (true|false to determine if content is embedded in TP or not), and 'url' (the url of the content)
customMenu.name: Other
